basics.name: Vasavya Sri
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: I am a Software Engineer with over five years in full-stack development, backend infrastructure, and cloud technologies. I have expertise in C#, ASP.NET, React, and Microsoft Azure, with a strong focus on designing scalable systems and optimizing performance. I’ve led teams to improve deployment efficiency and ensure high application reliability. I hold a Master’s degree in Computer Science from Santa Clara University.

education.institution: Santa Clara University, Santa Clara, CA

highlights:
Secured backend APIs using OAuth 2.0, implementing authentication and authorization mechanisms to ensure robust
protection of sensitive user data, reducing potential security vulnerabilities by 50%.

Leveraged Azure services (App Services, Functions) to enhance backend functionality, automating key processes and
ensuring seamless scalability for cloud-based applications.

Integrated Microsoft Power Automate to streamline data flow and automate repetitive tasks, reducing operational
overhead by 20%.

Designed and enhanced backend infrastructure using C#, ASP.NET (MVC 5.0/Core 3.0), and Web API to create RESTful
services. Improved backend to enable parallel test execution, reducing deployment time and increasing offer rollout
frequency by 300%, from monthly to weekly.

Led a team of 4 engineers to develop and integrate API solutions, reducing integration time by 25% and
improving efficiency by 30%, supporting seamless operations for over 11 million daily users.

Implemented CI/CD pipelines with Jenkins, reducing deployment time by 40% and increasing release frequency by
30%, while ensuring 99.9% uptime.

Predominantly focused on automating on-demand module scheduling and report distribution via email using Talend Open
Studio and Autosys, leading to an impressive 95% reduction in manual efforts

Developed a robust CI/CD pipeline using Jenkins, enabling seamless image deployment to Red Hat OpenShift. This
integration ensured scalability and agility, reducing deployment time by 30%.

Collaborated in the successful migration of over 100+ data transfer and load (ETL) modules for CITIBank, transitioning
them from traditional SQL to Talend jobs.

volunteer.organization: Center for Renewable Energy and Island Sustainability
volunteer.summary: Lead developer for weather sensing project
highlights: Design firmware for distributed weather sensor network
Maintain custom data collection and storage infrastructure
Webmaster/IT Officer, IEEE Student Branch, UH Manoa, 2012-2013

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: First place
awards.summary: My team won first place in 2015.  See my portfolio site for more details.
